comment.author: 92284803@N00
comment._content: Possibly Prince Yamashina Takehiko, "Prince" by a collateral line of the Imperial family.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: Looks like the guy in the Wikipedia picture, I agree. And the end of the line: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamashina-no-miya

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks bior and rjones0856, I looked through some photos of Prince Yamashina Takehiko and this does look like him, especially when you compare it to photos when he was younger. I tried to figure out who the other men are. The one on the right looks to be an admiral, and the one on the left is wearing medals and holding a naval-esque hat. I though maybe the man on the right is Admiral Hokojiro Ijichi, but this man seems a bit too old. I also saw a photo of Admiral Tomioka (I believe he was the grandfather of Admiral Sadatoshi Tomioki of WWII) but I could only find one photo and I wasn't convinced. If you have any thoughts let us know.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: I'm going to guess the older man is this guy: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kantar%C5%8D_Suzuki The age is about right, and he was vice minister of the navy at the time, important enough to be hanging with the prince. I dunno about the other man. If he was a naval officer, he might be in here somewhere: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Admirals_of_the_Imper... but I couldn't find anyone convincing. EDIT: When I first posted this I didn't look all the way to the bottom of the Wiki article about Suzuki. That photo was purportedly taken during his term as naval minister, and if so, he was both stockier and more highly decorated than the man in this photo. On the other other hand, this ( en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naval_ranks_of_the_Japanese_Empire_... ) says the man in the photo is a rear admiral in the IJN, and that's the rank Suzuki held at the time.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: To confuse things further, this photo is apparently out of the general sequence -- the date in the upper left corner is either 6/21/16 or 6/21/26.  The latter might make more sense, in that Prince Yamashina wasn't supposed to have graduated from the Naval Academy until 1918, and he's an ensign in this photo.
